instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
This board won?t turn on at all .
had no liquid damage , no sound when plug the charger .
i get 3.3v on pp3v3 G3h 
8.59v PPBUS G3H
3.3v <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
8.59v PPBUS S5 HS COMPUTING ISNS 
when plugged to charger cpu stay cold

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Any history available?
Does it charge the battery?
Try to start in SMC bypass.
Any pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> if you trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Yep it is bad SMC 
got it working thanks
